title: Teravail Unveils New Gravel Line With the New Circos Rim and Updraft Tire
content:
Today, Teravail unveiled its new gravel rim, the Circos, and Updraft tire. Let’s check it out below…

Circos Rim and Wheels

The Circos carbon gravel wheels are a first for Teravail. They offer a light and durable ride quality and are backed by a lifetime warranty. Available as a rim or a wheelset, with the latter being built with reliable and adaptable DT Swiss 350 hubs.

Specs:

  • Wheel MSRP: Front $590, Rear $795 (XD or HG 11)
  • Rim MSRP: $495
  • Rims available in 24 or 28-hole drilling
  • Wheelsets available in 28-hole only
  • 25 mm internal rim width
  • Hookless rim design with thick flange holds up to rugged gravel roads
  • Reinforced rim spoke bed with washers for added durability
  • Front- and rear-optimized rim drilling for better spoke bracing angles
  • ERTRO compliance for reliably easy tubeless setup; it works seamlessly with our tubeless tires, valves, and tape. Using two layers of 30mm-wide Teravail Tubeless Tape for Circos rims is recommended.
  • Rim backed by a lifetime warranty (see warranty information)
  • DT Swiss 350 hubs are smooth, reliable, and easy to service
  • Built with DT Swiss Competition spokes and DT Swiss Pro Lock nipples
  • Teravail Tubeless Tape installed and Tubeless Valve included
  • All Circos wheels are hand-laced, trued, and tensioned in Minnesota by professional wheel builders

Teravail Gravel Updraft Tires

Designed for high-speed riding and racing on gravel roads, the Updraft tires feature a fast-rolling modern file tread down the center to maximize acceleration and speed on hard-pack gravel. At the same time, supportive shoulder knobs provide assurance through loose corners.

Specs:

  • 120 TPI tubeless-ready casing delivers a compliant ride with minimal weight
  • Center file tread minimizes rolling resistance for easier acceleration and sustained speed
  • Shoulder knobs are raised and staggered for traction and tactile feedback when cornering
  • Fast rubber compound reduces rolling resistance for better acceleration and sustained speed

 

Check out the gravel system at Teravail.
